column2: Fuzzy sets are characterized by membership (characteristic function) $f_A(x)$
%cf|$f_A(x)$% associates each point in $X$ with a real number in the interval $[0,1]$
The value of %cf|$f_A(x)$% represents the "grade of membership" of $x$ in $A$
The nearer the vaue of %cf|$f_A(x)$% to unity, the higher the grade of membership of $x$ in %A|$A$%
Real number example of %fuzzy set%%fuzzy sets
Let $A$ be a set of %fuzzy set|fuzzy numbers% which are much greater than 1
Some representative values of %rcf|$f_A(x)$% for the %r|real number example%
A %fuzzy set|fuzzy set% is empty if and only if its %cf|membership function% is identically zero on %X|$X$%
Two %fuzzy set|fuzzy sets% $A$ and $B$ are %equality|equal% if and only if %cf|$f_A(x)$%$ = $%cf|$f_B(x)$% for all $x$ in %X|$X$%
Notationally, %equality|equality% is written as %fuzzy set|$A$%$ = $%fuzzy set|$B$%
Notationally, we will write %cf|$f_A$%$ = $%cf|$f_B$% to represent %cf|$f_A(x)$%$ = %cf|$f_B(x)$%
